hasDitaContent.@value: Both ranolazine and amifampridine prolong the QT interval. Most manufacturers advise avoiding the use of two or more drugs that are associated with QT prolongation. Increasing age, female sex, cardiac disease, and some metabolic disturbances (notably hypokalaemia) predispose to QT prolongation.

hasMessage.hasTextContent: Ranolazine   is predicted to   increase   the exposure to   ticagrelor .  Manufacturer advises use with caution or avoid .

hasDitaContent.@value: Tipranavir is predicted to increase the exposure to ranolazine. Manufacturer advises avoid.

hasMessage.hasTextContent: Tipranavir   is predicted to   increase   the exposure to   ranolazine .  Manufacturer advises avoid .

hasDitaContent.@value: Both ranolazine and tizanidine prolong the QT interval. Most manufacturers advise avoiding the use of two or more drugs that are associated with QT prolongation. Increasing age, female sex, cardiac disease, and some metabolic disturbances (notably hypokalaemia) predispose to QT prolongation.
